parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS system can cause the brakes to fail, leading to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potential injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal goes to the floor
the vehicle does not stop or slows down slowly
the ABS light illuminates intermittently
the brake fluid level fluctuates
and the vehicle experiences total brake failure.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The corrosion of the cradle bolts and retainers can cause the loss of steering control, leading to accidents and potential fatalities.
symptoms: The cradle bolts and retainers are severely corroded
rusted
or broken
which can cause the engine cradle to fail
leading to loss of steering control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The rusted-through engine cradle and broken, rusty bolts can cause a loss of steering control, leading to accidents or loss of vehicle control.
symptoms: Drifting or wandering on the highway
especially in icy conditions
difficulty steering
loose or unstable steering
uneven tire wear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front seat hydraulic mechanism can cause the seat to lunge forward during stops, potentially leading to serious injury or fatality, even when wearing a safety belt.
symptoms: The back part of the front seats moves forward suddenly during stops
the seat does not remain in a fixed position
the seat does not engage properly with the seat mechanism
the seat feels unstable or loose.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The electrical short in the instrument panel can cause the computer screen to malfunction, leading to a loss of vital information and potentially distracting the driver, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The computer screen on the instrument panel blinks off and on
the screen displays erratic or incorrect information
the screen is unresponsive or freezes.
